result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah Michael Heitman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall take medications only as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Michael Heitman

records.addlTxt: Defendant Isaiah Michael Heitman in court. Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def had PT with DA; agreement reached. Def pleads guilty; is convicted and sentenced.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Isaiah Michael Heitman in court. Def did not retain counsel; wishes to proceed without counsel. Def waives counsel to PT with DA. Plea hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Isaiah Michael Heitman appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Isaiah Michael Heitman. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Def will seek private counsel. Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
